That was completely understandable considering that, despite crouching, your back is literally pressing into the ceiling, which groans slightly under the pressure. No cracks have formed but you are sure that with just a little bit more force, the entire ceiling will begin to crumble.

Despite the intense pleasure that permeates the entirety of your huge, muscular body, you use all of your self-control to restrain your big tail from wagging and wounding your owner until you have turned to face him. However, as you do so, your massive backside slams into the mirror and knocks it off the wall. It hits the linoleum and smashes. Normally you would be afraid that your owner would be angry at you, but you are almost completely convinced that both of you have bigger, literally bigger, things to worry about now.

Once you have fully turned around, you can see that your owner had come suddenly to a stop when the mirror had smashed. It is then, at the worst possible moment that you begin to feel your growth begin to make its other effect known.

Your massive penis began to emerge from its sheath, swelling outwards until it nearly poked your owner in his chest, coming to rest just in front of him.

You feel the sudden urge to grab your owner between your teeth, shove him against your penis and force him to work it until you hit orgasm. As tempting as it is, you don't want to harm your owner and you don't want to damage the house. And you know that a ten foot German Shepherd hitting orgasm inside a building would be catastrophic for structural integrity. But you know that you need to do so soon before raw instinct takes over.

It is at that point that your owner looks up at you.

"Buddy, we've got to get out of here!"

You agree, but the question is: how?
121212.title: Sudden Urges

12122.content:
Speaking of intelligent decisions, before we continue down this path, it is probably for the best if there's the option to choose a different dog's story.

So here it is.
12122.title: Decisions

123.content:
So, you'd like to own a German Shepherd who can't stop growing, eh?

What gender do you want this giant dog to be?
123.title: Gender Options

choices: Has grown to 4 feet 4 inches at the withers (2X larger)!
Has grown to 8 feet 8 inches at the withers (4X larger)!
Has grown to 21 feet 8 inches at the withers (10X larger)!
1231.content:
You sit still in your bed, afraid to fall asleep. With the memories of the early evening fresh in your head, you can't even begin to question {how/i} you are able to sleep after what had happened two hours ago. You had just came home from a cartoonist's conference when you heard yipping in the basement. You remember, upon reaching the staircase's bottom, seeing a stranger, syringe in hand, instrument plunged into the fur of Hugo, your loving German Shepherd.
You screamed the dog's name.
Ran.
Punched the stranger square in the jaw.
But the strange man escaped, leaving Hugo with a needle stuck in his side, the lever already pushed in to the maximum.
You remember the pain.
Blood.
Sweat.
Howling.
Crying.
The dog was now sleeping at the foot of your bed, curled up, dreaming whatever dreams dogs dream of. Your only concern was Hugo's health. Did the syringe contain a harmful disease? A virus?
You turn over onto your side. Maybe those questions will all be answered tomorrow.

You wake up the next morning, still bleary-eyed, still tired. As you get dressed, you hear a bark emanating from the kitchen. "Time to fill the bowl up," you murmur as you head downstairs to the dining area. When you arrive at the kitchen, however, you are surprised to discover that Hugo...
1231.title: The Odd Case of Hubert the Dog

choices: Hugo wants to go for a walk.
12311.content:
You blink, and blink again at the impossible sight before you. Somehow, Hugo had grown overnight. The German Shepherd was twice his normal size, his head easily reaching your stomach in terms of height. In your mind, you are struggling to piece together the facts: Hugo was a big dog, but never was he {this/b} big. It all seemed so... wrong...
A bark snapped you out of your trance. "Oh, yeah..." you mutter, "It's time to feed him. Right." You travel downstairs, arriving at where Hugo's dog food bag usually sat. All the while, doubting thoughts about Hugo's increased size permeate your mind.
It can't possibly be real.
Dogs don't grow like that.
{No/b} animal grows like that. And yet...and yet...
You fill up the dog dish and Hugo walks over, hungry with the smell of food tickling his nostrils. He devours the food and looks up at you, his slightly larger head bumping your stomach as he licks his chops. Suddenly, he starts to whine, the noise rising and falling erratically. It seems clear to you that...
12311.title: Some Adjustments Needed

123111.content:
All things considered, it really does come as no surprise. After all, if you had suddenly awoken to discover that you had grown to twice your size, you would be extremely excited to go out and show off your new body as well. However, your main concern - aside from the fact that Hugo has apparently defied every single law of science, although you were no expert on that subject, that honor went to one of your friends - Alexander - was that Hugo could perhaps become too excited.

Or, Hugo could perhaps grow bigger.

It's a chilling concept. And for some reason, while you do find the thought terrifying you also find it... oddly exhilarating. The thought that Hugo might keep growing...

Everything, everything about this situation was wrong, just wrong. You cannot even begin to comprehend the emotions you feel when you consider a bigger Hugo. However, you have no more time to consider such a concept as Hugo lets out an almost ludicrously loud bark, bringing you back to reality to find Hugo sitting on his haunches, staring at you, with his thick tail rapidly swinging from side to side behind him.

You let out a deep sigh as you run a hand over your face before you walk into the living room and grab Hugo's collar from the shelf, along with the lead. With both collar and lead in hand, you return to Hugo and crouch down - noting that Hugo is now eye level with you when crouching - as you prepare to take him out. It is then that you encounter your first practical problem with Hugo's increased size.

It is now impossible to wrap the collar around Hugo's thicker neck. You make two more futile attempts before you give up with a frustrated sigh. Hugo cocks his head quizzically at you as you return to the living room and return the collar and lead to their original locations. You then walk back to Hugo and crouch down again.

Although you have already observed that Hugo is at eye level with you while crouching, it is still shocking to see just how big he is now. You take a deep breath to calm yourself, however, as you are perfectly aware that panic and fear in this situation will only make it worse.

"All right, Hugo. We're going out, without your lead, so for the love of God, stay close to me and don't go running off, okay?"

Hugo lets out another bark, turns and trots towards the front door. You have a brief moment of concern as to how Hugo will fit through the door but your concerns are allayed as Hugo demonstrates that he is capable of fitting through just fine.

With that, you grab the keys from the rack next to the door, step through, lock the door behind you and step up next to Hugo.

"Come on boy, let's go."

You both walk off to...
123111.title: Exercising an Enhanced Hugo.

choices: "Not grown since you were last here."
1231112.content:
Fortunately, it was still early in the morning - around 6:30 AM. That meant that there was no-one around to notice you - or the enormous German Shepherd that reached a whopping 4 feet and 4 inches at the withers. You were infinitely thankful for that because you did not want to explain to a terrified passer-by exactly how and why you were walking a dog whose head easily came up to your stomach. Mainly because you had no idea how and why you were. Although you hoped that Alexander could answer that.

Alexander Chemical was basically a Master of All. There was no simpler way of saying it. He was: an expert in every different scientific subject under the sun - and of the sun and beyond it; a qualified Medical Doctor; a world renowned surgeon; an expert Forensic Scientist specializing in DNA and Genetics; a brilliant musician, an excellent artist; an outstanding author; an incredible Amateur Olympian of an athlete and martial artist; a famous celebrity; and a charming socialite.

So if there was anyone on the planet who could explain what was happening to Hugo to you, it was definitely Alexander Chemical.

He was extremely wealthy - wealthy enough to own a multi-million dollar mansion - of a design somewhat reminiscent of a 'v', with a large garden with a pond, pool and tennis court in the back - atop a hill on the outskirts of the central district and the vast majority of the central district itself - yet did not allow this to go to his head. He was a polite, courteous and amiable individual who had no real enemies - in the central district that was, there were several people who had falsely accused him of various things and he had often taken the cases to court for that. Being a celebrity is not always an easy job.

And it was not going to be any easier after this morning.

That mansion was where you and Hugo were heading right now.

As you and Hugo walked up the hill towards Alexander's estate, it appeared as though Hugo had realised where they were going and he began to grow...

Damn, you really needed to not use that word at the moment. Especially when there was still the possibility that Hugo could still gr - get - bigger, and if so, you had no idea how much bigger Hugo could or would get.

You shake these thoughts away, literally, as you shudder in fear and... excitement. The thought of Hugo being big enough to look you in the eye, or perhaps look down at you, was still one that brought about conflicting emotions.

You shake these thoughts away also, mentally this time, as you realise that during your pondering about the future, you have almost reached Alexander's. At least Hugo has not run ahead - he would have easily pulled you right off your feet.

You hit the buzzer at the gate to Alexander's estate and waited, for what felt like an hour but was almost certainly only six seconds, trying to curb your anxiety, knowing that showing fear would only further excite the massive dog standing right next to you.

The buzzer gasped out a response.

"Yes, who is it?"

"Alex, it's me. Fred."

"Ah Fred, hello! One moment, I'll open the gate for you."

With that, the large white gates before you opened and you began to briskly walk to the front door of the mansion, which was sheltered by a large balcony for the upper floor that was supported by huge marble columns.

After a few seconds, you were able to make out Alexander's silhouette through the glass of the front door. His hair was a rather odd colour. It was a brown - a few shades lighter than his eyes - yet it appeared to be a fiery red. And not only was he a tremendously tall man, with a height of 6' 4" compared to your height of 6' even, he was also, most certainly, an impressively well-built man, with a powerful, well-defined musculature that had taken decades of intense effort and training and discipline to achieve.

When Alexander opened the door, he made to say something, almost certainly a greeting but stopped as soon as he laid eyes on Hugo.

"Wow. Wow."

"Yeah, hi Alex. As you can see, Hugo... Hugo got big. Like, really big. Like twice his usual size big. It happened after he got injected with something last night. And because you're a super-genius, I thought that you would be the best person to ask for an explanation."

Alexander looked at you to acknowledge that you said something before turning his gaze back to Hugo. The huge German Shepherd was sitting on his rear, cocking his large head to the side and staring intensely at Alexander with his big brown eyes.

Alexander let out a deep sigh.

"Of course, of course. I'd be happy to help, it's just that this is so... so... incredible."

You nod your head and make a noise of agreement. The whole situation truly was incredible.

Alexander let out another deep sigh.

"Alright. Let's step inside."

Alexander stepped to the side and gestured for Hugo and you to step inside. Hugo proceeded to do so first, the giant canine's head reaching Alexander's stomach - and unlike with you, not reaching 2" above the middle of the stomach but reaching the top of the stomach. The dog's height did not go unnoticed by Alexander, whose eyes widened in amazement at the realisation, as he turned to face you. You simply smile nervously, unsure of what you should say or if you should even say anything before you step inside as Alexander closes the door behind you.

Alexander guides you through the main hall, past the two stairways that move away from each other but with a space in the middle to allow access, past the huge decorative iron bell and then to the right, through the corridor and through the double doors into the living room, the surface beneath your feet changing from an immaculate stone grey and cream checkered marble to light wood panels with a dark border and grey diagonal square for each panel, except around the fireplace, which was surrounded by panels in the same style but with dark wood with a black border and the diagonal square was the same light wood of the other panels.

He gestured to you to take a seat on the modern white sofa and you did so, sitting on one side with Alexander opposite you with Hugo in the middle.

"So Fred, tell me exactly what happened last night."

So you did, telling him everything from your return from the Cartoonists conference to finding the stranger in your basement to waking up and finding Hugo in the state he was now.

"So, I was hoping that you could help me and find out why Hugo's grown. And if he might... well... you know..."

"Keep growing?"

"Yeah."

Alexander looked at you for a few seconds before he let out a deep breath through his nostrils.

"Very well. Leave him with me and I will examine him and ask my scientists at the Research Facility about this development."

You let out a loud sound of pure relief.

"Thank you Alex! Thank you!"

Alexander simply smiled.

You stroked Hugo's back a few times before you patted him on the head. And with that, you got up and walked home.

It was only a week before Alexander got back to you about Hugo. During that time you had been back at work, working on animations for some video game about cops fighting gangsters while jumping between cars. However, you had been unable to hide your anxiety over Hugo's situation, with several of your co-workers commenting on your condition. However, you had gotten through unscathed and you were relaxing at home when the call came through.

"Hello? Fred?"

"Alex! Have you found out what happened?"

"Yes, I have. You should come to my house so we can go over the results. However, there is something you should know."

"What's that?"

"Fred, Hugo has..."
1231112.title: Visiting the Mansion of the Master of all.

12311121.content:
(Note: This is a branch in which Hugo never stops growing and focuses on the ascension of a dog on his way to Godly sizes and accompanying omnipotence. If this is not what you are looking for, you should try the other path.)

You resisted the urge to drop your head into your hands in despair at the news. That was the one thing that you had hoped to not have to hear. Instead, you let out a breath through your nose and reply.

"All right, I'm on my way. Have everything ready for me for when I get there will you?"

Alexander assured you that he would have everything set up before the time that you got to his estate and with a few parting words of thanks, you hung up. You put your phone back in your pocket, looked up at the ceiling and groaned.

"How the hell did I get into this mess?" You asked up to no-one in particular, not really expecting an answer. Suddenly, you couldn't help but imagine looking up at Hugo, his face the only thing you could see, as he loomed what felt like miles overhead, his immense form blotting out the sky, the sheer power terrifying and chilling you as much as the look of loyalty and admiration in his eyes soothed and warmed you. You clench your teeth and run a hand over your face, attempting to dispel such fantasies from your mind.

But while you could shake off the visions, you couldn't shake off the question.

Why the hell did you get so excited whenever the thought of Hugo as a giant came around?

Pushing that thought to the side, you quickly readied yourself and rushed to the Chemical Estate, desperate to learn of your beloved pet's condition.

After nearly destroying the buzzer, you raced up to the entrance where Alexander was waiting for you with an unsettlingly anxious look on his face. He was dressed casually, in only a pair of white running shoes, a pair of black jogging pants and a plain white t-shirt. That was immediately a massive red flag for you, Alexander was brilliant but not perfect. One of his flaws was his near obsession with always looking his best. Such a casual way of dressing suggested that something was horribly, horribly wrong. And as you slowed to a stop in front of the large marble fountain in front of the main entrance, the sight that he hadn't shaved was another major concern. Alexander was always perfectly clean-shaven. Something was definitely wrong.

"Oh, God. How big is he?" Were the first words out of your mouth as you ran across from your car.

"Quite big. However, it's nothing compared to how big I expect him to get in the future. I don't want to rush you, but when you've finished reuniting, I need to talk with you in my office. I've got some seriously important predictions I need to show you." With that, Alexander showed you through the hall and pushed open the doors to the lounge.

The sight that met your eyes was so shocking that you were impressed that you actually remained standing.

You feel your jaw drop in astonishment as you take in what you are seeing. The last time that you saw him, Hugo was easily far bigger than an average German Shepherd, with his size being around twice the usual maximum of his breed. Standing before you, however, is an impossibly immense titan of a dog, easily bigger than the tallest horses, reaching a height of what you estimated at 8 feet and 8 inches!

You were really standing in front of a dog the size of an elephant.

The fact sends a cold shiver of something that isn't fear flowing down your spine, and you don't want to start thinking about why that is again.

Hugo's tail began to wag furiously at the sight of you before pushing his huge head into your chest, nearly bowling you over as he nuzzled you, clearly happy to see you after such a long absence. Gently pushing his head to the side slightly, you take a couple of steps forward and extend your right hand towards the giant canine, placing it on one of Hugo's massive and very solid chest muscles. God, it felt like solid steel under his warm, soft fur! And you were all too happy to get to feel said lovely pelt again as you pressed into Hugo's huge chest, lovingly embracing him as he returned the gesture as best he could, considering he was over two feet taller than you, his head curled around your back, with huffs and groans of delight emanating from his broad torso.

Out of the corner of your peripheral vision, you can see Alexander walk to his office door on the diagonal wall opposite the door you came in, while you tell Hugo to join you as you sit down on the sofa, accompanied by a few soft encouragements.

Hugo followed your lead and parked himself on the love seat perpendicular to the sofa in front of the fireplace. Unfortunately, with such tremendous size, comes tremendous weight. The smallest of African elephants reach around 5 tons. Hugo was bigger than the smallest of African elephants.

The love seat let out a long, drawn-out groan of agony as the wood sagged under the immense weight of Hugo's body as he tentatively lowered his rear onto it. You held your breath as Hugo paused, the groans falling silent as Hugo stilled for a few seconds before placing the rest of his full weight upon the love seat.

Hugo didn't even have the chance to rest so much as half of his weight before the love seat suddenly and dramatically collapsed; the wooden frame was crushed into shattered splinters and the stuffing exploded outwards all over the floor as the fabric containing it burst under the sudden increase of pressure. exponentially

You lept back from Hugo, startled, resting against the opposite armrest. You spied Alexander staring at Hugo in surprise out of the corner of your eye before your attention was quickly grabbed by Hugo again. He let out a high-pitched whine, big brown eyes wide, ears flattened against his head, which he had lowered down so that it was at eye level, instead of looming nearly 3 feet above you.

That tugged at your heartstrings and you immediately shot up and hugged the huge dog as best you could in an attempt to soothe him.

"Shush, shush. It's okay Hugo. It's okay. I know you didn't mean it. It's alright. You're still a good boy."

The effect on Hugo was immediate. His ears perked up and his big tail began to wag happily, as he bumped his head into your chest, tongue lolling out of his mouth in happy relief.

Not wanting to either end up coated in saliva by Hugo's tongue or to keep looking at those impressively sharp teeth of his, you decided you should go and see what Alexander wanted to talk to you about. With a few soft words and a pat on his muscular flank, you made your way to the office.
12311121.title: Revelations Part 1

123111211.content:
Unlike the lounge, with its cream flooring and white stone walls, the office had a much darker colour scheme with rich ochre wall panels and floorboards, with the navy blue rug in the center of the room, and the deep burgundy of the armchairs and the sofa against the wall opposite the door, providing a bit of contrast

At the far wall, in front of the white marble fireplace, rested Alexander's desk, a hand-crafted construct, made of solid oak and painted in a deep mahogany, the same tone as the bookcases that lined the walls, only broken up on the rear-facing wall by large windows that were currently concealed behind the thick curtains. Behind that desk sat Alexander, who looked up at you with a veritable maelstrom of expressions, but the one that was the most evident was the unmistakable look of fear.

You couldn't help the sudden tightness in the base of your stomach.

"Ah Fred, I'm glad that you and Hugo are back together, he's really been missing you," Alexander says, his expression shifting from a stressful frown to a small, happy smile. However, the smile fades as he looks back to the laptop sitting on the desk.

He let out a deep sigh and put his face in his hands for a brief moment before clasping his hands together and resting his elbows on the desk. "Fred, you should probably sit down for this. It is, as they say, a doozy."

You press your lips together as you take a seat in one of the armchairs in front of the desk, unease gnawing away at you.

You wonder what could possibly be so serious as to rattle Alexander.

Once you've settled into the plush cushions of the armchair, Alexander speaks up. "Fred, I will be frank with you here. I kept Hugo at the lab for most of the day, every day, for the past week so I could have some tests run, almost exclusively medical tests. They came back with results that are, well, alarming, to say the least." Your eyes widened as a rush of heat rose up from the center of your chest, the tightness spreading throughout the rest of your torso.

"Don't worry! Don't worry, Hugo is currently not in any danger whatsoever!" Alexander cried out, clearly seeing your distress. "Rather," He closed his eyes and let out a deep sigh. "I am afraid that it is Humanity that is in serious danger."

"What!?" You blurt out in shock, bolting upright in your seat.

"Fred, I'll fully admit, I am not an expert on canine anatomy and physiology. Human, yes, definitely. I'm a world-renowned expert on that subject. But not canine. So I brought in an outside veterinarian to consult with. He did the tests, but I did the analysis."

Looking down at his laptop and clicking on something, he continued. "Now, I won't go into detail because we may not have time for that, but the first thing we found is that Hugo is healthy. As in, perfectly healthy. As in, 'he is at the absolute peak of physical perfection' healthy. His vitals are great and his skin, fur, eyes, teeth and everything else are in excellent condition. That led us to the next discovery. Hugo has, quite literally, infinite stamina."

You blinked in surprise. "Woah, hang on. Infinite? Seriously? I mean, yeah, he's a giant now but that sounds like a bit of an exaggeration."

Alexander chuckled. "Well, admittedly, I can't definitively say infinite as we haven't tested him for infinity, but I extrapolated the data and it's quite clear that Hugo could easily perform physical activity, hypothetically, forever, without ever breaking a sweat or feeling a workout burn."

You whistled in amazement. "Wow. Okay, that's incredible. Although, something tells me that that isn't what's got you so rattled."

He sighed, lowering his head into his hands. "No. No, it isn't. Because while Hugo's physical capabilities are incredible, we discovered something else. Something that truly frightens me, Fred."

You feel the hairs on the back of your neck rise in anticipation of this awful, awful find.

"What is it?" You croak out, your mouth suddenly feeling dry.

Alexander looks you straight in the eye, the gaze so intense that it actually scares you slightly.

"Fred, I analyzed Hugo's blood and made a remarkable discovery. I'll go into the details in a moment but the main thing I discovered was this: Hugo is still growing. And he will never, ever stop."

Your mind locked up for a moment, almost unable to comprehend what he had just told you. Never, ever stop growing? Ever?

"Ever?"

"Ever. According to the charts, Hugo will keep exponentially growing in size and strength. Fred, it's so extreme, the mathematics used to calculate this actually break down at the more extreme sizes! If my calculations are correct, Hugo will outgrow the current theorized size of the entire universe in about a week! And that is with optimistic projections!" Alexander cried, eyes wide with alarm and just a tinge of despair.

You froze, your body temperature rising in horror, disbelief, denial, and something else that you don't want to think about right now.

The universe? The universe!?

What the holy hell!?

"And, Fred. There's something else I have to confess. I know who injected Hugo with that syringe."

"You do!?" You gasp out.

"Yes." Alexander nods solemnly.

"Yes, that man was..."
123111211.title: Revelations Part 2

choices: Settle Hugo down to sleep and head off to bed yourself, all this is exhausting!
Stay up and comfort Hugo. He's your dog after all, you love him! He deserves it!
1231112111.content:
"You!?" You gasp, eyes widening in shock.

Alexander lowers his head in shame. "Yes, I did it." He whispered.

Of everything you had expected after that bombshell, that was certainly not one of them.

You stare at him for a long moment before you blurt out the only question that comes to mind. "Why?"

His face turns a deep scarlet as he averts his gaze. "I-I was drunk."

You sit back, letting out a deep sigh. "Alex, I'm afraid you're going to have to explain that a bit more."

He puts his head in his hands, rubbing at his temples for a few seconds before he stands up. "Very well." He says, tone shifting into that of an academic presenting a paper at a symposium.

"Fred, what I'm about to tell you is top secret, but considering that by the end of the week, we're all going to be smothered beneath a literally incalculable mass of German Shepherd, I'll happily explain."

You feel a shiver run down your back as he mentions the sheer size Hugo will eventually reach; you shove it aside for the time being.

"Now, I'm on a contract with DARPA to create a new drug - specifically, a drug to help make dogs fitter and stronger for police and military work. I won't bore you with all the scientific information but basically, it's a combination of steroids to start the process and nanites to carry out the process. Once the steroids start, the nanites take over and exponentially accelerate the process until they're all used up as, due to a detail of nanomachines, they can't self-replicate, so we give them more doses as required. Are you following me so far?"

You rub your forehead as you run through all this information. "Yeah, I think so."

Alexander nods, relief slipping over his face. "Good, good. So, after that, they undergo a CRISPR procedure, you know, that gene editing technique you'll have no doubt seen in the news. It's designed to give them denser muscles, denser bones, clearer vision and so on. However, here's where I deviated. Using an artificially created retrovirus, I put them all together into a cocktail and gave it straight to Hugo after mixing myself one, or possibly, six, cocktails too many that night."

You let out a quiet sigh of despair. Of all the things that could lead to the end of humanity, it wasn't nuclear war; climate change; pollution, disease, famine, drought or anything like that. It was a single, intoxicated genius with a syringe full of an artificial wonder drug.

"Oh boy, let me guess, that's what's causing this?" You groan.

"Fred, I don't know for certain, but that blood test I told you about? I put a drop under the electron microscope, and literally, every cell had a nanite. Every cell! Considering a single drop has several million cells, that means several trillion nanites throughout his entire body! Now, considering the cocktail had nowhere near that many..." He trailed off, a shudder visibly running through his body.

You blink in confusion for a few seconds before you let out a gasp. "Woah, hold on. You mean those nanites can self-replicate? But I thought you said they couldn't?"

"They can't!" Alexander cried, his voice rising slightly in alarm.

"They can't, but they have! And that means that it'll keep going and going and Hugo will keep growing and growing, forever!" He whimpers, voice rising higher as he talks, putting his head into his hands at the end, shuddering in pure, unadulterated horror.

Your entire body suddenly feels as cold as an Arctic winter as you croak out a question. "What do we do now?"

Alexander raises his head to look you in the eye with a look of total despair.

"Now? Now I try desperately to come to terms with the fact that a single night of drunken bravado has brought about the end of all things and you go out there and spend time with Hugo and hope and pray that when the time inevitably comes, our new god shows you mercy."

You can only nod weakly as you push yourself up and step out with a brief raising of your hand in goodbye.

You step out of the office, back into the comfortable lounge to find Hugo staring at you, his head cocked to the side ever so slightly; it would be completely adorable if it weren't made somewhat terrifying by the knowledge that he, Hugo, your loving pet German Shepherd - already the size of an elephant, was going to become an unstoppable titan of destruction in less than a week. The big dog gave out a soft whine as he padded closer, leaning down and pushing his big nose against your chest, a slightly wet, cold sensation coming through your shirt.

"Oh, Hugo. God, what am I going to do boy?" You lament.

In response, Hugo whines again, nuzzling down into you, tail wagging gently. He steps back and turns around three times before planting his huge, muscular body down. He looks at you and then at his bulging, muscled flank a few times before you get the message.

You smile softly as you step forward, getting down on your knees and snuggling up to Hugo's immense bulk, chuckling as his tail whips around in delight at being so close to his master.

Pressed against Hugo's flank, you feel that odd rush of heat again, which only increases as Alex's explanation plays again in your mind. Damn it, why was this happening? Why did it seem to get more intense whenever the prospect of Hugo growing came up?

You run a hand over your face as you start to realize why that might be before your attention is grabbed by Hugo, the enormous dog nosing down on you lovingly.

You chuckle at that, reaching up to scratch the massive canine behind his ears, Hugo huffing up a storm as he groans in pleasure, his tail wagging furiously, smacking into the sofa he lay in front of, sending it closer to the coffee table with every smack.

You smile up at Hugo's happy face, wondering what you'll do now, Alex's grim warning replaying in your mind, eliciting a shudder from you that has nothing to do with temperature. Hugo notices this and snuggles in closer, practically pinning you against his bulk with his snout.

Well, looks like you'll be spending the night here, although you sort of guessed you'd have to do that anyway since there's no way that you'd be able to sneak an elephant-sized dog all the way back to the suburbs, assuming he could even fit through the doors now.

As if on cue, Alex walks through the doors, jumping at the sight of Hugo so close to him. He takes a moment before asking, with a slight grin of amusement. "Don't suppose you'd like to stay the night?"

You grin back, a lopsided smile coming across your face. "Well, I don't think I have much of a choice, do I?"

Earthquake?
Impossible, since you lived nowhere near the fault lines.

A sharp but sonorous sound suddenly deafens your ears, at which point you look up, way, way up, at the muzzle and eyes of Hugo, now a colossal monstrosity of a canine. His snout was dripping blood, and it smelled fresh.

"Holy shit, Hugo," you exclaim, transfixed by the sight of your dog's immense size, "you've really grown! I-I'm half-believing this, but..." You stop as you notice the blood on his muzzle.
"Hugo," you ask, "what have you been eating, boy?"
As always, the dog provided no human-like answer. But he did bark again and wag his giant tail in response. "I-I'm gonna' look downstairs," you say, still reeling from the effects of hearing two ear-splitting barks from a colossal dog. You feel nauseous as you walk downstairs, almost to the point of vomiting. Ignoring the taste of throw-up, you search for the dog food bag, hoping it would turn up somewhere.
It didn't.
You storm back towards Hugo, who has a guilty look in his eyes. Before you attempt to pipe up, you know that Hugo had obviously ate the whole bag clean. He always gave you that look whenever he did something you weren't a huge fan of.
You drop your arms in submission. "Fine."

But then, you had an idea. "Hugo," you said, full of excitement and joy...

13321.content:
You hated the outdoors.

Not only did you have to contest with Alaska’s freezing temperatures and natural hazards, you had to go through constant abuse due to your size. Being a runt doesn’t gain you much respect as a sled dog, it seems. You were trying to pull a sled at this very moment, in fact, but you were just too weak to keep up. For some reason, you were feeling terrible sick today. “Please, Jasper! Get moving!” The coachman driving the wagon begged in exasperation. “Don’t give up on me now, girl!” You tried as hard as you could, but you were just feeling too sick to keep pulling. You turn to him, a sad look on your face. “Damn…”

The resident dog trainer notices the sled had stopped, and runs over. “What’s wrong?” He asks the coachman. “We have to move this cargo!”

“Jasper’s not feeling herself today,” the driver explains, somberly. “Bring her to the doghouse. Get another dog to replace her. We can’t be late.”

“Damn it. Get over here,” the trainer grumbled, unlatching your harness and grabbing you harshly. “Useless fuckin’ mutt...” You whimpered as the houndmaster dragged you roughly by the neck towards the doghouse. You were always obedient as can be. You didn’t know why he always had to be so cruel.

You hated the great outdoors, but you hated the ‘doghouse’ even more. The enclosure was just one big room, locked from the outside, filled with huskies of all sorts, left to do as they please with one another. You were the runt of the ‘pack’, and thus, you were mocked and bullied relentlessly by the other dogs for your weakness. They only left tiny leftovers for you to eat, meaning you were constantly hungry, and all the male canines felt free to mount you whenever they wished, knowing you were too weak to fight back. By most everyone you knew, you were treated cruelly, and most assumed such a weak dog wouldn’t survive long in the harsh Alaskan tundra. You limped over to a corner of the big cell, trying to ignore the mockery of the other canines, and curled up, shivering at the awful feeling emanating from inside your body.

It felt like your muscles were getting too big for your skin, if that made any sense. As if you were being stretched to your very limits somehow. The other huskies were completely ignoring you now, wrestling and playing amongst themselves, not even noticing as you began to grow in height by an inch, and then another, and then another. It wasn’t until half an hour had passed, and you had grown an entire foot, that one of the other dogs began to notice. He began to bark at you, calling the attention of the others. You were already a little taller than even the largest of the other canines, and your growth had no end in sight. Soon, all of the dogs were barking at you as you grew exponentially faster, and you whimpered as you covered your sensitive ears. The process of growing this large was incredibly uncomfortable, and your belly, already empty, becoming even moreso as it increased in size. The hunger and discomfort gnawed at you, and even though it was a miracle, you could only lay there whimpering, hoping that it would be over soon.

Eventually, of course, the growth does seem to be staunched somewhat. You sit up on your haunches, composing yourself… only to realize that you were now 5 feet tall, from your paws to your withers, over three times you original size! You were bigger than some humans, even; the other dogs, who used to be so much larger than you, were now cowering in fear beneath you as you towered over them. As you looked into the faces of your tormentors, a smile came to your face. You didn’t know why you were so big now, but you were sure that none of the other dogs would bother you ever again! Still, you had other problems to deal with. Your stomach gurgles loudly, announcing your hunger to every dog in the cell. You were starving. You walked forward through the crowd, the scared canines parting like the red sea around you, as you walked over to the barrels of dog food on the other side of the room. You dipped your tongue inside one of them, rolling a big ball of delicious food down your throat. The other dogs could only sit there and watched as you ravenously devoured all their precious food.

The soft, wet surface suprises him and he let's go of the bar. All but his head slides down your throat. Before he can scream, a final gulp sends him into your belly with the other man. Your stomach droops further. The feeling from your belly grows stronger, you want more humans in your belly.
15422222111.title: Meal time

1542222212.content:
With a belly to fill you follow the scent of prey, the perfume and cologne of the humans down-town being irresistible.

Being nearly seven feet tall you hunker down to appear less threatening, wagging your tail and lolling around like a friendly giant. Many of the humans admire your clean fur and cannot resist stroking you but you are looking for something special.

You are looking for a tasty human that is alone.

A tasty human that will fill your belly.

You follow the tasty scent to a coffee house where busy humans are grabbing a cup of steaming caffeine on their way to work or college.

You could enjoy filling your belly with some coffee flavoured flesh, or maybe the figures in the park would be more fun. Watching skaters whizzing past and guys playing ball on their way to class stirs your hunting instinct.

But maybe you're not the only hunter. There is an animal control van parked at the side of the coffee house and you instinctively know this could be bad news.
1542222212.title: Hunting downtown

1543.content: What have you always wanted to be?
1543.title: Another kind of dog.

15433.content: How about a Bull Terrier? Or maybe a Pit Bull?
15433.title: More choices.

choices: You're 70 feet tall time to rampage.
You're 15 feet tall you need to find a way to become bigger.
1543311.content:
You proceed to close your eyes, as you make your wish while the night sky flashed above, until suddenly your own vision changes. Everything fades to black as you hit the ground with a loud thud.

At dawn early the next morning, you woke up with your dog tongue hanging out in an truly desperate effort to cool yourself down.

Hold on, long dog tongue hanging out?!?!

You proceed to stand up and bark rather loudly when you've finally realize that you were now a feral bull terrier and a big one as well!
1543311.title: Bull Terrier

1543312.content:
So you're transformed into a Pit Bull?

Before we get into whether or not you are a feral or anthropomorphic canine, what gender are you?
1543312.title: Pit bull

154332.title: More breeds

info.description:
This is a story about canines growing to giant sizes.
Growth can be fast or slow, But not instantaneous.
Growth only for the canines please.
Shrinking is allowed,1 inch being as small as you can go; but dogs can only shrink back to their original size.
Not every chapter has to have growth in it. The main idea is that there is a dog bigger than normal.
No hyper or fattening stuff please, not to say that some things can't grow a little bit. Just try and keep things somewhat proportional.
Dogs can be male or female.
Dogs can be intelligent or normal. If they are smart, please give a reason why.
Scat stuff is allowed, but keep it to a minimum please.
Tf is also allowed but only humans into dogs, not the other way around.
Dogs can be gentle, playful, rampaging, naughty whatever you want. That's up to you.
The dogs cannot talk unless you give a reason why they can.
No rules on sexual content.
No rules on vore either.

Have fun!
